awd_titl_txt: Indiana University Molecular Structure Center Upgrade
awd_abstract_narration: This award from the Chemistry Research Instrumentation Program                  will help the Department of Chemistry at Indiana University at                  Bloomington upgrade of its the x-ray diffraction laboratory.                    Among the areas of chemical research that will be enhanced by                   the upgrade are the following:                                                                                                                                  1)  3d metal carboxylate chemistry, with concentration of                       effort on Mn and Fe,                                                                                                                                            2)  early transition metal/sulfur chemistry, primarily of V,                                                                                                    3)  the study of paramagnetic hydride compounds,                                                                                                                4)  the compositional and structural characterization of                        plastic and disordered solids,                                                                                                                                  5)  dinuclear transition metal chemistry,                                                                                                                       6)  small molecule activation by alkoxide supported metal                       clusters,                                                                                                                                                       7)  molecular precursors in solid-state synthesis, and                                                                                                          8)  metallorganic polymers and liquid crystals.                                                                                                                 Single crystal x-ray crystallography is the most powerful                       analytical method for structure determination of solids.  In                    synthetic inorganic, organic, bioinorganic and organometallic                   chemistry, single crystal x-ray diffraction is an invaluable                    tool to characterize molecular structure.  The information                      gained from the knowledge of the molecular composition and                      structure helps to develop new reactions of potentially general                 interest in catalysis or synthesis.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
